intro: Spermacoce tenuior var. floridana, commonly known as Florida moonflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, white, night-blooming flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and thrives in partial to full shade. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, white, fluffy seeds.
